intro: Castanopsis echinocarpa var. seminuda, commonly known as the naked bristled tallowwood, is a species of evergreen tree native to Australia. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and beeches, and is characterized by its hard, durable wood. The plant produces small, cupule-enclosed nuts that mature over several years. Its leaves are typically alternate, simple, and革质 (leathery), with a dark green upper surface and a lighter underside. This variety is distinguished by its reduced bristles on the fruit, giving it the "naked" appearance in its name.
